tit.cmt: 他の記事に合わせて補足しました。

sen.j: 千手観音（せんじゅかんのん）、サンスクリットサハスラブジャ・アーリヤ・アヴァローキテーシュヴァラ(sahasrabhuja aaryaavalokitezvara)は、仏教における信仰対象である菩薩の一尊。
sen.e: Senju Kannon, sahasrabhuja aaryaavalokitezvara in Sanskrit, is a venerable entity of Bosatsu, Bodhisattva, which is worshipped in Buddhism.
Senju Kannon, sahasrabhuja aaryaavalokitezvara in Sanskrit, is a venerable entity of Bosatsu, Bodhisattva, which is worshipped in Buddhism.
Senju Kannon, sahasrabhuja aaryaavalokitezvara in Sanskrit, is a venerable entity of Bosatsu, Bodhisattva, which is worshipped in Buddhism.

sen.j: 「サハスラブジャ」とは文字通り「千の手」の意味である。
sen.e: Sahasrabhuja' means 'a thousand arms' literally.
Sahasrabhuja' means 'a thousand arms' literally.
Sahasrabhuja' means 'a thousand arms' literally.

sen.j: この名はヒンドゥー教の女神ドゥルガーの異名でもあり、インドでヒンドゥー教の影響を受けて成立した観音菩薩の変化身（へんげしん）と考えられている。
sen.e: This name is a synonym of Durga, a goddess in Hinduism as well, and Senju Kannon is considered to be a transformed body of Kannon Bodhisattva, Kannon Bosatsu, which was established in India influenced by Hinduism.

This name is a synonym of Durga, a goddess in Hinduism as well, and Senju Kannon is considered to be a transformed body of Kannon Bodhisattva, Kannon Bosatsu, which was established in India and influenced by Hinduism.

This name is a synonym of Durga, a goddess in Hinduism as well, and Senju Kannon is considered to be a transformed body of Kannon Bodhisattva, Kannon Bosatsu, which was established in India under influence of Hinduism.
sen.cmt: 余分なスペースをのぞき表現を変えました。

sen.j: 六観音の一尊でもある。
sen.e: It is one of 6 Kannon, Roku Kannon.
It is one of 6 Kannon, Roku Kannon.
It is one of Roku Kannon (6 Kannon).

sen.j: 三昧耶形は開蓮華（満開のハスの花。聖観音の初割蓮華と対をなす）、蓮華上如意宝珠。
sen.e: Sanmayagyo Symbol is opened lotus (lotus flower in full bloom. A pair of shokatsu renge (slightly-opened lotus bud) of Sho Kannon) and Nyoi hoju, wish-fulfilling jewel on lotus.
Sanmayagyo Symbol is an opened lotus (lotus flower in full bloom. A pair of shokatsu renge (slightly-opened lotus buds) of Sho Kannon) and Nyoi hoju, a wish-fulfilling jewel on lotus.

Sanmayagyo Symbol is an opened lotus (lotus flower in full bloom. A pair of shokatsu renge (slightly-opened lotus buds) of Sho kannon (Holy Deity of Mercy)) and renge-jo (on lotus) nyoi hoju (a sacred jewel, said to remove suffering, and capable of granting every wish).
sen.cmt: 他の記事に合わせ、修正しました。

sen.j: 種子 (密教)（種字）はキリーク(hriiH)。
sen.e: Shushi (Mikkyo, Esoteric Buddhism) (Shuji) is hriiH.
Shushi (Mikkyo, Esoteric Buddhism) (Shuji) is hriiH.
Shushi (Mikkyo, Esoteric Buddhism) (Shuji) is hriiH.

sen.j: 解説
sen.e: Commentary
Commentary
Commentary

sen.j: 日本語では「十一面千手観音」、「千手千眼（せんげん）観音」「十一面千手千眼観音」、「千手千臂（せんぴ）観音）」などさまざまな呼び方がある。
sen.e: In Japanese there are various names such as 'Juichimen Senju Kannon,' 'Senju-sengen Kannon,' 'Juichimen Senju-sengen Kannon' and 'Senju-sempi Kannon.'
In Japanese there are various names such as 'Juichimen Senju Kannon,' 'Senju-sengen Kannon,' 'Juichimen Senju-sengen Kannon' and 'Senju-sempi Kannon.'

In Japanese there are various names such as 'Juichimen Senju Kannon' (Eleven-faced and thousand-armed kannon), 'Senju Sengen Kannon' (Thousand-armed and thousand-eyed kannon), 'Juichimen Senju Sengen Kannon' (Eleven-faced, thousand-armed and thousand-eyed kannon) and 'Senju Senpi Kannon' (Thousand-armed and thousand-elbowed kannon).
sen.cmt: 各用語を補足しました。

sen.j: 「千手千眼」の名は、千本の手のそれぞれの掌に一眼をもつとされることから来ている。
sen.e: The name of 'Senju-sengen' originates from that it has each one eye in each palm of a thousand arms.
The name of 'Senju-sengen' originates from the fact that it has one eye in each palm of a thousand arms.
The name of 'Senju-sengen' originates from the fact that it has one eye in each palm of a thousand arms.

sen.j: 千本の手は、どのような衆生をも漏らさず救済しようとする、観音の慈悲と力の広大さを表している。
sen.e: A thousand arms show such a vastness of Kannon's mercy and power as it tries to relieve any living things surely.
A thousand arms indicates the vastness of Kannon's mercy and power as endeavours to relieve living things.
A thousand arms indicate the vastness of Kannon's mercy and power as endeavors to relieve every living things.

sen.j: 観音菩薩が千の手を得た謂われとして、伽梵達摩訳『千手千眼觀世音菩薩廣大圓滿無礙大悲心陀羅尼經』がある。
sen.e: The reason why Kannon Bosatsu got a thousand arms is written in "Senju-sengen Kanzeon Bosatsu Kodaiemman Muge Daihishin Darani-kyo Sutra" translated by Gabon-Datsuma.
The reason why Kannon Bosatsu have a thousand arms is written in "Senju-sengen Kanzeon Bosatsu Kodaiemman Muge Daihishin Darani-kyo Sutra" translated by Gabon-Datsuma.

The reason why Kannon Bosatsu have a thousand arms is written in "Senju-sengen Kanzeon Bosatsu Kodaienman Muge Daihishin Darani-kyo Sutra" (Nilakanta (ka) -sutra) translated by Gabon-Datsuma (Bhagavaddharma).
sen.cmt: 各用語を補足しました。

sen.j: この経の中に置かれた大悲心陀羅尼は現在でも中国や日本の禅宗寺院で読誦されている。
sen.e: Daihishindarani in this sutra has been recited at Zen sect's temples in China and Japan still now.
Daihishindarani in this sutra has been recited at Zen sect temples in China and Japan up until the current time.
Daihishin Dharani (Great Compassionate Heart Dharani) in this sutra has been recited at Zen sect temples in China and Japan up until the current time.

sen.j: 六観音の一尊としては、六道のうち餓鬼道を摂化するという。
sen.e: As a member of Roku Kannon, it is said to Sekke (摂化) (civilize) Gaki-do among Rikudo (Rokudo, six posthumous worlds).
As a member of Roku Kannon, it is said to be Sekke (摂化) (civilize) Gaki-do among the Rikudo (Rokudo, six posthumous worlds).
As one of the Roku Kannon, it is said to provide salvation for the dead in Gaki-do (the Realm of the Hungry Dead), which is one the Rokudo (the six realms of existence).
sen.cmt: 表現を変えました。I have no idea what "edify the dead" is supposed to mean so I have revised this based on the definition 摂化 given in Kojien (生を救いとり).

sen.j: また地獄の苦悩を済度するともいい、一切衆生を済度するに、無礙の大用あることを表して諸願成就・産生平穏を司るという。
sen.e: In addition, it is also said to relieve suffering at hell and control the achievement of various wishes and peaceable birth by showing that there is a benefit of no obstacle (無礙の大用) for relief of all living things.

In addition, it is also said to relieve suffering in hell and control the achievement of various wishes and peaceful birth by showing that there is a benefit of no obstacle (無礙の大用) for relief of all living things.

In addition, it is also said to relieve suffering in hell and control the achievement of various wishes and peaceful birth by showing that there is a benefit of no obstacle (無礙の大用) for relief of all living things.

sen.j: 名称
sen.e: Names
Names
Names

sen.j: 千手観音の尊名は、前述の通りさまざまな呼び方がある。
sen.e: There are various honorific names of Senju Kannon as above.
There are various honorific names of Senju Kannon as above.
There are various honorific names of Senju Kannon as above.

sen.j: 千手観音像の中には十一面ではなく二十七面につくる像もあり、必ずしも「十一面千手千眼観音」が正しいとは言いきれない。
sen.e: Among Senju Kannon statues, there is a statue with 27 faces instead of 11 faces, so that 'Juichimen Senju-sengen Kannon' is not always true.
Among Senju Kannon statues, there is a statue with 27 faces instead of 11 faces, so that 'Juichimen Senju-sengen Kannon' is not always true.
Among Senju Kannon statues, there is a statue with 27 faces instead of 11 faces, so that 'Juichimen Senju-sengen Kannon' is not always true.

sen.j: また、文化財保護法による国宝、重要文化財の指定名称は「千手観音」に統一されている。
sen.e: In addition, the designated name for national treasure and important cultural property based on Act on Protection of Cultural Properties is unified to 'Senju Kannon.'
In addition, the designated name for national treasure and important cultural property based on the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties is unified to 'Senju Kannon.'
In addition, the designated name for national treasure and important cultural property based on the Act on Protection of Cultural Properties is unified to 'Senju Kannon.'

sen.j: 密教の曼荼羅では観音像は「蓮華部」に分類されている。
sen.e: In Mandala in Mikkyo, Kannon statues are classified to 'Renge-bu, Lotus Family.'
In Mandala in Mikkyo, Kannon statues are classified to 'Renge-bu, Lotus Family.'

In Mandala (Mandala, or a diagram that depicts Buddhist deities according to certain geometric formats and illustrates the Buddhist world view) in Mikkyo, Kannon statues are classified to 'Renge-bu' (Lotus Family).

sen.j: 千手観音を「蓮華王」とも称するのは観音の王であるとの意味で、蓮華王院（京都の三十三間堂の正式名称）の名はこれに由来する。
sen.e: It means that Senju Kannon is also called 'Rengeo (lotus king)' because it is a king of Kannon, so that the name of Rengeo-in (the formal name of Sanjusangendo Temple in Kyoto) originates from this.
It means that Senju Kannon is also called 'Rengeo (lotus king)' because it is a king of Kannon, so that the name of Rengeo-in (the formal name of Sanjusangendo Temple in Kyoto) originates from this.
It means that Senju Kannon is also called 'Rengeo' (lotus king) because it is a king of Kannon, so that the name of Rengeoin (the formal name of Sanjusangendo Temple in Kyoto) originates from this.
sen.cmt: クォーテーションなど表記を変えました。

sen.j: 像容
sen.e: Features of statue
Features of statue
Features of Statue

sen.j: 坐像、立像ともにあり、実際に千本の手を表現した作例もあるが、十一面四十二臂とするものが一般的である（和歌山・道成寺本尊像は例外で、四十四臂に表わす）。
sen.e: Although there exist both seated statues, standing statues and statues with a thousand arms actually, generally it has 11 faces and 42 arms (the statue of Honzon, principal image of Buddha, at Dojo-ji temple in Wakayama is an exception with 44 arms).

Although there exist both seated statues, standing statues and statues with a thousand arms actually, generally it has 11 faces and 42 arms (the statue of Honzon, principal image of Buddha, at Dojo-ji temple in Wakayama is an exception with 44 arms).

Although there exist both seated statues and standing statues, and statues with a thousand arms actually, generally it has 11 faces and 42 arms (the statue of principal image of Buddha, at Dojo-ji Temple in Wakayama is an exception with 44 arms).
sen.cmt: コンマの位置、表記をかえました。

sen.j: 四十二臂の意味については、胸前で合掌する2本の手を除いた40本の手が、それぞれ25の世界を救うものであり、「25×40＝1,000」であると説明されている。
sen.e: An explanation for the meaning of the 42 arms is following; the 40 hands except two clasped hands in prayer at the front of the breast relieve each 25 world, that is, '25X40=1,000.'
An explanation for the meaning of the 42 arms is as follows; the 40 hands except two clasped hands in prayer at the front of the breast relieve each of the 25 worlds, that is, '25X40=1,000.'
The 42 arms is explained as follows; the 40 hands except two clasped hands in prayer at the front of the breast relieve each of the 25 worlds, that is, '25X40=1,000.'

sen.j: ここで言う「25の世界」とは、仏教で言う「三界二十五有（う）」のことで、天上界から地獄まで25の世界があるという考えである（欲界に十四有、色界に七有、無色界に四有があるとされる）。
sen.e: This '25 worlds' mean 'three realms and Twenty-five forms of existence' in Buddhism, and that there are 25 worlds from heaven to hell (it is considered that 14 worlds in Yokkai (the realm of desire), 7 worlds in Shikikai (the realm of form) and Mushikikai (the realm of non-form).

This '25 worlds' mean 'three realms and twenty-five forms of existence' in Buddhism, and that there are 25 worlds from heaven to hell (it is considered that there are 14 worlds in Yokkai (the realm of desire), 7 worlds in Shikikai (the realm of form) and Mushikikai (the realm of non-form).

The '25 worlds' here means 'three realms and twenty-five forms of existence' in Buddhism which is a thought that there are 25 worlds from heaven to hell (it is considered that there are 14 forms in Yokkai (the realm of desire), 7 forms in Shikikai (the realm of form) and 4 forms in Mushikikai (the realm of non-form).

sen.j: ちなみに「有頂天」とは二十五有の頂点にある天上界のことである。
sen.e: Incidentally, 'Uchoten' means the heaven on the top of Twenty-five forms of existence.
Incidentally, 'Uchoten' means the heaven on the top of Twenty-five forms of existence.
Incidentally, 'Uchoten' means the heaven on the top of Twenty-five forms of existence.

sen.j: 京都三十三間堂の本尊（坐像）は、鎌倉時代の仏師湛慶の代表作であるとともに、十一面四十二臂像の典型作である。
sen.e: The Honzon at Sanjusangendo Temple in Kyoto (seated statue) is a representative work of Tankei, a Busshi (a sculptor of Buddhist statues) in Kamakura Period and a typical work of the statue with 11 faces and 42 arms.

The Honzon at Sanjusangendo Temple in Kyoto (seated statue) is a representative work of Tankei, a Busshi (a sculptor of Buddhist statues) in the Kamakura Period and is a typical statue with 11 faces and 42 arms.

The statue of principal image at Sanjusangendo Temple in Kyoto (seated statue) is a representative work of Tankei, a Busshi (a sculptor of Buddhist statues) in the Kamakura period and is a typical statue with 11 faces and 42 arms.
sen.cmt: スペース他表記を変えました。

sen.j: 42本の手のうち2本は胸前で合掌し、他の2本は腹前で組み合わせて宝鉢（ほうはつ）を持つ（これを宝鉢手という）。
sen.e: The two hands among 42 hands are joined in prayer in front of the breast and in the other two hands brought together in front of stomach there is Hohatsu (a bowl used by Buddhist monks for meals, and as a begging bowl) (this is called Hohatsu-shu (宝鉢手)).

The two hands among 42 hands are joined in prayer in front of the breast and in the other two hands brought together in front of stomach there is Hohatsu (a bowl used by Buddhist monks for meals, and as a begging bowl) (this is called Hohatsu-shu (宝鉢手)).

The two hands among 42 hands are joined in prayer in front of the breast and in the other two hands brought together in front of stomach there is Hohatsu (a bowl used by Buddhist monks for meals, and as a begging bowl) (this is called Hohatsu-shu (hands for Hohatsu)).

sen.j: 他の38本の脇手にはそれぞれ法輪、錫杖（しゃくじょう）、水瓶（すいびょう）などさまざまな持物（じもつ）を持つ。
sen.e: In the other 38 hands there are various Jimotsu (the hand-held attributes of a Buddhist image) such as Horin (Dharma-wheel (cakra)), Shakujo (pewter staff) and Suibyo (water jug).
In the other 38 hands there are various Jimotsu (the hand-held attributes of a Buddhist image) such as Horin (Dharma-wheel (cakra)), Shakujo (pewter staff) and Suibyo (water jug).
In the other 38 hands there are various Jimotsu (the hand-held attributes of a Buddhist image) such as Horin (Dharma-wheel (cakra)), Shakujo (pewter staff) and Suibyo (water jug).

sen.j: 38手に何を持つかについては、像によっても異なり、必ずしも決まっていない。
sen.e: Jimotsu in 38 hands is different from statues and is not necessarily uniform.
Jimotsu with 38 hands is different from statues and is not necessarily uniform.
Jimotsu with 38 hands is different from statues and is not necessarily uniform.

sen.j: また、長年の間に持物が紛失したり、後世の補作に替わっている場合が多い。
sen.e: In addition, some Jimotsu were often lost through the years or changed to supply materials in later age.
In addition, some Jimotsu were often lost through the years or changed to supply materials in later age.
In addition, some Jimotsu were often lost through the years or changed to supply materials in later age.

sen.j: 奈良唐招提寺金堂像（立像）、大阪葛井寺本尊像（坐像）、京都寿宝寺本尊像（立像）は、実際に千本の手を表現した作例である。
sen.e: The statue at Toshodai-ji Temple kondo (golden hall) in Nara (standing statue), the Honzon statue at Fujii-dera Temple in Osaka and the Honzon statue at Juho-ji Temple in Kyoto are the works which actually expressed a thousand arms.

The statue at Toshodai-ji Temple Kondo (golden hall) in Nara (standing statue), the Honzon statue at Fujii-dera Temple in Osaka and the Honzon statue at Juho-ji Temple in Kyoto are works which actually expressed a thousand arms.

The statue at the main hall of the Toshodai-ji Temple in Nara (standing statue), the statue of principal image in Fujii-dera Temple in Osaka and the statue of principal image in Juho-ji Temple in Kyoto are works which actually expressed a thousand arms.

sen.j: 像高5mを超える唐招提寺像は大手が42本で、大手の隙間に無数の小手（現存953本という）を表わす。
sen.e: The statue at Toshodai-ji Temple which is over 5m high has 42 big arms and immeasurable small arms (it is said that 953 arms remain) in the space of big arms.
The statue at Toshodai-ji Temple, which is over 5m high, has 42 big arms and many small arms (it is said that 953 arms remain) in the spaces between the large arms.
The statue at Toshodai-ji Temple, which is over 5 m high, has 42 big arms and many small arms (it is said that 953 arms remain) in the spaces between the big arms.

sen.j: 葛井寺像は、大手が40本（宝鉢手をつくらない）、小手は1,001本である。
sen.e: The statue at Fujii-dera Temple has 40 big arms (with no Hohatsu-shu) and 1,001 small arms.
The statue at Fujii-dera Temple has 40 big arms (with no Hohatsu-shu) and 1,001 small arms.
The statue at Fujii-dera Temple has 40 big arms (with no Hohatsu-shu) and 1,001 small arms.

sen.j: 葛井寺像の小手は、正面から見ると像本体から直接生えているように見えるが、実は、像背後に立てた2本の支柱にびっしりと小手が取りつけられている。
sen.e: The small arms of the statue at Fujii-dera Temple look coming out directly from the body of statue, seen head-on, but actually small arms are put on the two column supports standing on the back of statue with no space.

The small arms of the statue at Fujii-dera Temple appear to be coming out directly from the body of the statue, seen head-on, but actually, the small arms are put on the two column supports standing at the back of statue with no space.

When viewed from the front, the small arms of the statue in Fujii-dera Temple appear to be coming directly out of the body, but they are actually attached to two column supports that stand just behind the statue.

sen.j: 葛井寺像の大手・小手の掌には、絵具で「眼」が描かれていたことがわずかに残る痕跡から判明し、文字通り「千手千眼」を表わしたものであった。
sen.e: From wisps it became clear that 'eyes' were painted on the palms of big and small arms of the statue of Fujii-dera Temple and that it had 'a thousand arms and a thousand eyes' literally.
From wisps it became clear that 'eyes' were painted on the palms of the big and small arms of the statue at Fujii-dera Temple and that it had 'a thousand arms and a thousand eyes' literally.
The remaining traces of eyes painted on the palms of the large and small arms of the statue at Fujii-dera Temple demonstrate that the statue once had literally 'a thousand arms and a thousand eyes'.

sen.j: 日本における信仰と造像例
sen.e: Faith and works of statue in Japan
Faith and examples of statues in Japan
Faith and Examples of Statues in Japan

sen.j: 千手観音の造像例は、インドにはほとんど知られないが、中国では唐代の龍門石窟などに遺例がある。
sen.e: While the works of Senju Kannon statue are hardly known in India, there are works in China such as longmenshiku in Tang Dynasty.
While Senju Kannon statues are hardly known in India, there are examples in China such as longmenshiku from the Tang Dynasty.
While Senju Kannon statues are hardly found in India, there are remains in China such as Longmen Caves from the Tang Dynasty.
sen.cmt: 他の記事に合わせました。

sen.j: 日本での千手観音信仰の開始は古く、空海が正純密教を伝える以前、奈良時代から造像が行われていた。
sen.e: In Japan Senju Kannon began to be worshipped at the early age and it had been shaped to a statue since Nara Period before Kukai transmitted pure esoterism.
In Japan, Senju Kannon began to be worshipped in an early age and it had been shaped into a statue since the Nara Period before Kukai transmitted pure esoterism.
In Japan, Senju Kannon began to be worshipped in an early age and it had been shaped into a statue since the Nara period before Kukai transmitted pure esotericism.

sen.j: 東大寺には天平年間に千手堂が建てられたことが知られ、同寺の今はない講堂にも千手観音像が安置されていた。
sen.e: It was known that Senju-do was built in Todai-ji Temple from 729 to 749 and the Senju Kannon statue was placed in its Kodo (Lecture Hall) which does not exist now.
It was known that Senju-do was built in Todai-ji Temple from 729 to 749 and the Senju Kannon statue was placed in its Kodo (Lecture Hall) which does not exist now.
It was known that Senju-do hall was built in Todai-ji Temple from 729 to 749 and Senju Kannon statue was placed in its Kodo (Lecture Hall) which does not exist now.

sen.j: 日本における現存作例では、8世紀半ばの制作とされる葛井寺像が最古とされ、唐招提寺像も8世紀末～9世紀初頭の作品である。
sen.e: Among existing works in Japan, the statue at Fujii-dera Temple, which is considered to have been made in the middle of 8th centuries, is recognized as the oldest work, and the statue at Toshodai-ji Temple is a work from the end of the 8th centuries to the beginnings of the 9th centuries.

Among existing works in Japan, the statue at Fuji-dera Temple, which is considered to have been made in the middle of the 8th century, is recognized as the oldest work, and the statue at Toshodai-ji Temple is a work from the end of the 8th century to the beginning of the 9th century.

Among existing works in Japan, the statue at Fujii-dera Temple, which is considered to have been made in the middle of the 8th century, is recognized as the oldest work, and the statue at Toshodai-ji Temple is a work from the end of the 8th century to the beginning of the 9th century.

sen.j: 和歌山・道成寺の秘仏北向本尊像の胎内からは大破した千手観音像が発見されているが、これは道成寺草創期の本尊と思われ、奈良時代に遡るものである。
sen.e: A badly damaged statue of Senju Kannon was discovered in the body of Kitamuki (北向) Honzon statue, a Buddhist image not usually shown to the public, at Dojo-ji Temple in Wakayama, which seems to be the Honzon at the early age of Dojo-ji Temple during Nara Period.

A badly damaged statue of Senju Kannon was discovered in the body of Kitamuki (北向) Honzon statue, a Buddhist image not usually shown to the public, at Dojo-ji Temple in Wakayama, which seems to be the Honzon from the early age of Dojo-ji Temple during the Nara Period.

A badly damaged statue of Senju Kannon was discovered in the body of Kitamuki (north-faced) principal image, a hidden Buddhist statue, at Dojo-ji Temple in Wakayama, which seems to be the principal image from the early age of Dojo-ji Temple during the Nara period.
sen.cmt: 用語表現を変えました。

sen.j: その他、千手観音をまつる著名寺院としては、清水寺、三十三間堂、西国札所の粉河寺などがある。
sen.e: Besides these, Kiyomizu-dera Temple, Sanjusangendo Temple and Kokawa-dera Temple of Saigoku Fudasho (西国札所) are famous for enshrining Senju Kanon.
Besides these, Kiyomizu-dera Temple, Sanjusangendo Temple and Kokawa-dera Temple of Saigoku Fudasho (西国札所) are famous for enshrining Senju Kanon.
Besides these, Kiyomizu-dera Temple, Sanjusangendo Temple and Kokawa-dera Temple, a pilgrim stamp office of the Saigoku (western part of Japan), are famous for enshrining Senju Kannon.
sen.cmt: スペルおよび用語修正しました。

sen.j: 京都・清水寺本尊（立像）は、33年に一度開扉の秘仏で、42本の手のうちの2本を頭上に挙げて組み合わせる独特の形をもち、「清水型」といわれている。
sen.e: The Honzon statue at Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto is a Buddhist image which is shown to the public only once in 33 years, and shows original form to bring two arms together over the head among 42 arms, which is called 'Kiyomizu style.'

The Honzon statue at Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto is a Buddhist image which is shown to the public only once in 33 years, and shows the original form to bring two arms together over the head among 42 arms, and is called 'Kiyomizu style.'

The principal image at Kiyomizu-dera Temple in Kyoto is a Buddhist image which is shown to the public only once in 33 years, and shows the original form to bring two arms together over the head among 42 arms, and is called 'Kiyomizu style.'

sen.j: 同じ清水寺の奥之院本尊の秘仏千手観音像は珍しく27面をもつ坐像である。
sen.e: The Honzon statue of Senju Kannon, which is a Buddhist image not usually shown to the public, at Oku-no-in of Kiyomizu-dera Temple is a seated statue with the rare 27 faces.
The Honzon statue of Senju Kannon, which is a Buddhist image not usually shown to the public, at Oku-no-in in Kiyomizu-dera Temple is a seated statue with a rare 27 faces.
The principal image of Senju Kannon, a hidden Buddhist statue in Okunoin in the Kiyomizu-dera Temple, is a seated statue with rare 27 faces.
sen.cmt: 用語表記を変えました。

sen.j: 千手観音の持物（じもつ）については、『千手千眼陀羅尼経』（詳しくは『千手千眼観世音菩薩広大円満無礙大悲心陀羅尼経』）などの経典に説かれており、実際の彫像、画像などもおおむね経典にしたがって造形されている。
sen.e: Jimotsu of Senju Kannon is described in the sutras such as "Senju-sengen Darani-kyo Sutra" (for details, "Senju-sengen Kanzeon Bosatsu Kodaiemman Muge Daihishin Darani-kyo Sutra"), and its actual statues and pictures have been made in accordance with sutras basically.

Jimotsu of Senju Kannon is described in the sutras such as "Senju-sengen Darani-kyo Sutra" (for details, "Senju-sengen Kanzeon Bosatsu Kodaiemman Muge Daihishin Darani-kyo Sutra"), and actual statues and pictures have been basically made in accordance with the sutras.

Jimotsu of Senju Kannon is described in the sutras such as "Senju-sengen Darani-kyo Sutra" (Senju-sengen Kanzeon Bosatsu Kodaienman Muge Daihishin Darani-kyo Sutra), and actual statues and pictures have been basically made in accordance with the sutras.

sen.j: 宝戟（ほうげき）千手観音が左手に持つ杖状のもの。
sen.e: Hogeki (宝戟) is a kind of staff in the left hand of Senju Kannon.
Hogeki (宝戟) is a kind of staff in the left hand of Senju Kannon.
Hogeki, a stick in the left hand of Senju Kannon.
sen.cmt: 表現を変え、漢字をのぞきました。

sen.j: 先端が3つに分かれた武器。
sen.e: It is a three-pronged weapon.
It is a three-pronged weapon.
It is a three-pronged tipped weapon.
sen.cmt: 先端が、を補足しました。

sen.j: 宝鐸（ほうたく）小型の鐘のこと。
sen.e: Hotaku (宝鐸) is a small bell.

sen.j: 紫蓮華（しれんげ）

sen.j: 払子（ほっす）元来は蝿などを追い払うための道具。
sen.e: Hossu is originally a tool to drive away insects such as flies.
Hossu is originally a tool to drive away insects such as flies.

sen.j: 羂索（けんさく）投げ縄のこと。

sen.j: 日輪（にちりん）経典には「日精摩尼」（にっしょうまに）とある。

Nichirin is 'nisshomani (日精摩尼)' in sutras.

sen.j: 宝輪（ほうりん）経典には「不退金輪」とある。
sen.e: Horin is expressed as 'Futai Kinrin (不退金輪)' in sutras.
Horin is expressed as 'Futai Kinrin (不退金輪)' in sutras.
Horin, expressed as 'Futai Kinrin' (literally, non-retrogression golden wheel) in the sutras.

sen.j: 宝螺（ほうら）ほら貝。
sen.e: Hora is a conch shell.
Hora is a conch shell.
Hora, a conch shell.

sen.j: これに代えて「宝釧」（ほうせん、腕輪）をもつこともある。

sen.j: 『千手千眼陀羅尼経』では以上の38本の持物をもつ手に加えて「合掌手」と「宝鉢手」を含めて40本の手について言及している。
sen.e: In "Senju-sengen Darani-kyo Sutra" there is a description of the 40 arms including 'Gassho-shu (合掌手)' and 'Hohatsu-shu' in addition to the 38 arms with Jimotsu as above.
In "Senju-sengen Darani-kyo Sutra" there is a description of the 40 arms including 'Gassho-shu (合掌手)' and 'Hohatsu-shu' in addition to the 38 arms with Jimotsu as above.
In "Senju-sengen Darani-kyo Sutra" there is a description of the 40 arms including 'Gassho-shu' (praying hands) and 'Hohatsu-shu' in addition to the 38 arms with Jimotsu as above.
sen.cmt: 日本語をのぞき、補足しました。

sen.j: 日本における千手観音の実際の造像例を見ると、腹前（坐像の場合は膝上）で2本の手を組み、その上に宝鉢を乗せる形式のものが多い。
sen.e: Among actual works of Senju Kannon statues in Japan many of them show the style with bringing two hands together in front of the stomach (on the knee in the case of seated statues) and putting Hohatsu on it.
Among actual Senju Kannon statues in Japan, many show the style of bringing two hands together in front of the stomach (on the knee in the case of seated statues) and putting Hohatsu on it.
Among actual Senju Kannon statues in Japan, many show the style of bringing two hands together in front of the stomach (on the knee in the case of seated statues) and putting Hohatsu on it.

sen.j: 宝鉢を持つ2本と胸前で合掌する2本の手を合わせて42臂となる。
sen.e: The 42 arms consist of the two with Hohatsu and the other two clasped in prayer, in addition to the 38 arms with Jimotsu.
sen.cmt: 2本と2本では42にならないので38本の説明を加えました。
sen.e: The 42 arms consist of two with Hohatsu and two clasped in prayer, in addition to the 38 arms with Jimotsu.
The 42 arms consist of two with Hohatsu and two clasped in prayer, in addition to the 38 arms with Jimotsu.
